position: Summer Internship in Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Development
description:
Citi Handlowy is a bank which combines the experience and the best traditions of the Polish banking with a modern model of finance. Citi Handlowy is one of the strongest local banking institution and an integral part of Citi - a leading financial services company, having approximately 200 million customer accounts and operating in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.


Here at Citi Handlowy we recognize and develop talents by investing in ambitious students and graduates who are not afraid to take on challenges. We follow trends and support the development of our employees by introducing new technologies and providing mobile access to knowledge sharing portals and online databases.


If youre enthusiastic, willing to learn and work hand in hand with experienced professionals, we invite you to take part in our **Summer Internship Program within Process Automation, Data Analysis or Model Development areas** . The internship starts in **July 1st** with an Orientation Day - training of essential skills as well as comprehensive orientation to Citis culture. Afterwards, you will join your individual team to work on your business assignments till **September 15th** .


During the Summer Internship you will be exposed to a variety of tasks to help you understand the business and build your portfolio of professional skills. You will have the possibility to work in one of the following business areas: Operations and Technology, Consumer Banking, Risk Management, Compliance and Finance.


**Examples of takss related to process automation** :


+ understanding and reviewing processes

+ creating, testing and implementing tools supporting processes automation


**Examples of tasks related to data analysis** :


+ creating and administrating of databases

+ analyzing data, looking for conclusions and proposing solutions


**Examples of tasks related to model development** :


+ understanding, monitoring and testing current models

+ supporting model development in Risk Management Sector


**What we expect:**


+ full-time availability form July 1st do September 15th

+ at least a second year student (by June 2021) of: IT, Quantitative Methods, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, STEM, Finance or related

+ very good MS Office skills (especially MS Excel including macros and MS Access)

+ one of: SAS, VBA, SQL

+ strong analytical and problem-solving mindset

+ demonstrating clear professional interest, proactivity and self-motivation

+ good command of both English and Polish (minimum B2 level)


**What we offer:**


+ possibility to gain globally appreciated work experience

+ support in professional development

+ constant support from your assigned buddy

+ contract of employment

+ benefits, including health care and Multisport

+ possibility to continue your career within Citi after the internship


If you are particularly interested in a specific area, you can add a comment in your CV. Your preference will be taken into consideration.


The role is located at Bank Handlowy S.A. in Warsaw: https://www.citi.com/Careers/policies/pdf/BankHandlowyPolandPrivacyNotice.pdf

Raytheon is seeking a rising college senior in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics for a Summer 2021 Internship Position to work a team performing system integration, testing, and deployment of software maintenance releases or system infrastructure for the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS).
This ground system supports low earth orbiting environmental satellites and provides global coverage, monitors environmental conditions, collects, disseminates and processes data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.



The successful candidate for this position will possess an interest in space systems and work with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers.
In this role, tasks will be composed of about 50% planning/process analysis and support, and 50% hands-on test support in the factory test environment.
The CGS is a large, complex, and geographically distributed system.
Team members depend on each others expertise in different subsystems, so fluid communication, cooperation and cohesion among all team members is a necessity for success.
This is a continuous-learning environment where everyone must teach each other and have the confidence and interest to acquire knowledge that may be outside of ones particular academic background.



This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to U.S, Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.



This position requires access to export-controlled Technical Information, hardware, software, and/or services that is restricted to U.S. Citizens



Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:


+ Support the planning, tracking, and analysis of team tasks/functions


+ Execute ground control system software test procedures in the factory test environment


+ Support COTS and hardware integration in the factory test environment


Requirements:


+ Experience with project planning and task management


+ Experience with computer software and hardware


+ Ability to successfully communicate essential technical information to those outside of your particular engineering discipline or area of expertise


+ Must be a college Senior student by Fall 2021


+ U.S. Citizenship




Desired Requirements:


+ ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard


+ Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (Please upload an unofficial transcript when applying)


+ Ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlines


+ Ability to adapt to rapidly changing environment / tasking direction


+ Knowledge of Signal Processing


+ Knowledge of basic TCP/IP networking


+ Advanced MS Excel skills


+ Programming experience with interest in scripting in Python or Perl


Required Education:

Currently pursuing a BS / BA degree from a four-year university and entering as a college Junior or Senior year OR pursuing a MS / MA / PhD by Fall 2021.
Must be working towards a degree in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics, or equivalent technical discipline.
Must be appropriate grade level listed above.177879

System Modeling Engineer Graduate Intern

Job Description

This position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.

This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Data Center NAND Division as a System Modeling Engineer and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses many industry-leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell (QLC) NAND Flash products. As a System Modeling Engineer, you will be part of a world-class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK Hynix.

This position aligns to Phase 1 of the transaction, which includes the 3DNAND enterprise and client SSD business. Phase 1 is expected to close in late 2021, subject to regulatory approvals and other customary conditions. At deal close, all employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition to SK Hynix.

In this position, you will be working as part of the Silicon-Systems Architecture team within Intel's Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group (NSG) to design and implement software to improve the performance of Intel's future Solid State drives.

This will be for a minimum 6 month period starting Summer 2021 and full-time hours.

Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

  • Assist in the design and implementation of tools that augment Intel's SSD performance modeling capabilities

  • Perform SSD performance data collection and analysis

  • Participate in code reviews

  • Ramp quickly on architecture, design/technical

  • Programming, Scripting Language, debugging, and technical problem solving skills

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience using external libraries

  • Previous internships

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group:  The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices.  The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

Job Description:

The Hardware Engineering Center (HWEC) is an engineering organization that centerson product producibility and mission assurance.
It is a vital link in the integrated product development process that allows Raytheon Intelligence & Space to introduce reliable new products faster, better, and more economically.


The effective candidate will participate in multi-discipline teams supporting primarily military programs through application of EE instruments and design processes.
Chosen candidate will be a team member working on the design, analysis and support of electronics products. This may include digital, analog, power and mixed signal circuit card assemblies, FPGA/VHDL programming or ASIC support, sustaining and production electronics support, components engineering, and product development engineering.


Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:

- Participating as a team member in detailed circuit design

- Configurable digital logic development using VHDL

- Functional analysis

- Functional verification testing

- Working with engineering and production personnel to troubleshoot and provide root cause and corrective action to design and process issues


The chosen candidate will learn frequent use and application of technical standards, principles, concepts and techniques.

Candidates will be expected to provide recommendations to a variety of technical problems of appropriate scope and complexity, working under general supervision.
Effective candidates should expect to be immersed in a exciting, team-based, and challenging technical environment where an team member with ability and initiative can thrive.


This role will primarily deal with digital and mixed signal systems.
An ideal background would deal with reconfigurable logic design (FPGAs), PCB design, linear and nonlinear circuit design, low level software design principles, LabVIEW experience, and a high proficiency with Microsoft Office tools.


Security Clearance & Other Requirements

Contract Hours: 40 hours per week

Anticipated Start Date: April 2021

Office Location: Remote / Virtual

 

Purpose & Objective of Position

 

The Cybersecurity Compliance Automation Engineer (CCAE) will work on a mission-critical project that spans numerous international teams. In this role, the CCAE will find ways to successfully deliver while working with teams that have common goals, but different priorities, objectives, and points of view.

 

The CCAE will develop, test and deploy Compliance templates for all types of cloud infrastructure. Additionally, the CCAE will centralize Compliance log collection, reporting, and incident management.

 

The CCAE will gain experience writing scripts for a wide variety of systems and applications (load balancers, firewalls, storage devices, directory services, etc.). The CCAE will also develop integration points for application APIs, enrich scan data, and develop Executive and Operations dashboards.

 

The CCAE is a key member of the Continuous Compliance program. Continuous Compliance is a critical security component of SAPs OneStrike initiative. The CCAEs purpose and objective is to take written internal and external security compliance requirements and transform them into Compliance as Code.

 

Expectations & Tasks

 

The CCAE will write Compliance as Code templates for SAP cloud infrastructure. The CCAE will also contribute to the development of compliance reporting, system integration and incident management processes.

 

Skills / Competencies

 

The CCAE should have a general proficiency in software development, automation and cybersecurity. The CCAE will need to be a quick learner, and adaptable to changing technologies and security requirements.

 

Educational Requirements

 

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science or related field
  • Cybersecurity certifications such as CISSP and Security+ are beneficial, but not required

 

Qualifications

 

  • Software development experience
  • Automation experience
  • Experience with working in one of the Cybersecurity domains

Raytheon is seeking a rising college senior in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics for a Summer 2021 Internship Position to work a team performing system integration, testing, and deployment of software maintenance releases or system infrastructure for the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS).
This ground system supports low earth orbiting environmental satellites and provides global coverage, monitors environmental conditions, collects, disseminates and processes data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.



The successful candidate for this position will possess an interest in space systems and work with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers.
In this role, tasks will be composed of about 50% planning/process analysis and support, and 50% hands-on test support in the factory test environment.
The CGS is a large, complex, and geographically distributed system.
Team members depend on each others expertise in different subsystems, so fluid communication, cooperation and cohesion among all team members is a necessity for success.
This is a continuous-learning environment where everyone must teach each other and have the confidence and interest to acquire knowledge that may be outside of ones particular academic background.



This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to U.S, Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.



This position requires access to export-controlled Technical Information, hardware, software, and/or services that is restricted to U.S. Citizens



Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:


+ Support the planning, tracking, and analysis of team tasks/functions


+ Execute ground control system software test procedures in the factory test environment


+ Support COTS and hardware integration in the factory test environment


Requirements:


+ Experience with project planning and task management


+ Experience with computer software and hardware


+ Ability to successfully communicate essential technical information to those outside of your particular engineering discipline or area of expertise


+ Must be a college Senior student by Fall 2021


+ U.S. Citizenship




Desired Requirements:


+ ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard


+ Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (Please upload an unofficial transcript when applying)


+ Ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlines


+ Ability to adapt to rapidly changing environment / tasking direction


+ Knowledge of Signal Processing


+ Knowledge of basic TCP/IP networking


+ Advanced MS Excel skills


+ Programming experience with interest in scripting in Python or Perl


Required Education:

Currently pursuing a BS / BA degree from a four-year university and entering as a college Junior or Senior year OR pursuing a MS / MA / PhD by Fall 2021.
Must be working towards a degree in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics, or equivalent technical discipline.
Must be appropriate grade level listed above.177879

As a Software Engineer on our team you will work alongside other engineers developing test diagnostics to validate the quality of our storage products. + The candidate should exhibit self-sufficiency, high levels of motivation, and the ability to quickly and thoroughly learn new and complex topics.

+ Fluency in English and good collaboration sprit.

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAPs global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:

1.    Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network. 
2.    Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.  
3.    Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, youll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips. 

 

 

About the team: 

SAP Litmos was founded to create a learning management system (LMS) that was quick to set up, easy to manage, and fun to use. 

Even with our many years of growth, our commitment to being the worlds easiest-to-use LMS is why we have over 22 million users in more than 130 countries and 28 languages use the solution and the online training courses we provide.

Our like-minded team utilizes years of industry experience to provide an innovative product and trusted partnerships with our customers. We you will work in an environment based on cutting edge technologies and cloud computing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hYWbQ4HVOGM

Position title: SAP iXp Intern- Software Engineer 
Location: San Ramon, California (Virtual)
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 Aug 2021
 

In this role, youll:
In this role, you will join a dynamic team of engineers, QA and project managers who are changing the future of online learning and connect our system to the world. Creating an API is beneficial in many ways. API creation is the foundation for future serious development projects. Businesses use the API creation to increase resource adoption, and seasoned developers put an effort into specialization of their API design skills to connect these businesses to SAP Litmos

 

The main focus of your work will be around building and maintaining microservices for our REST API core. You will help in managing, analyzing and serving out LMS data to our customers.  Additionally, you will work on automated data processing/reporting datasets with programming.

 

Our primary coding languages are .NET and Sql Server. Our tech stack includes AWS, Github, Bamboo.

Software Development (80%):

Author, update, and debug API microservices
Contribute to API design and architecture
Write comprehensive unit and end-to-end tests
Write documentation for API and other backend processes that meet developer needs and OpenApi quality standards
Diagnose and mitigate performance issues
Write code to automate data updates and streamline data management
Participate in reviewing peers code

Data Analytics (20%):
Develop a variety of reports, charts, models, & analysis that have a direct impact on all aspects
Perform ad-hoc quality audits to investigate data anomalies
 

Who you are:

Were looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

 

Nice to haves:

Ability to quickly learn new technologies, architectures, and best practices
Tireless problem-solver.
High proficiency in English
Experience with OpenApi, Postman or Swagger 
Familiar with .Net Technologies and SSMS 
Familiar with Javascript

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

Product Software Engineer

Fall Internship (August 2021 - December, full-time work schedule, Monday- Friday 40 hours per week)

The modern world runs on the Internet, and the Internet cannot exist without its underlying infrastructure. Meraki makes setting up, managing, and maintaining that infrastructure easier than it has ever been before. Meraki enables connectivity everywhere from neighborhood cafes to elite universities to global hospitality groups operating thousands of sites.


As a Product Software Engineer at Meraki, you will bring life to our products, imbuing them with what some call the Meraki Magic. Through your contributions, you will enable our customers to do more things more easily than ever before. You will have opportunities to work across our stack, developing software ranging from bootloaders, device drivers, and routing code to our distributed, cloud-hosted backend.


Here are some of the projects you might find yourself working on:

  • Designing and implementing (usually in C/C++) features to improve the reliability, simplicity, and performance of our devices, as well as make them more flexible and powerful
  • Bringing up our Linux-based system on new hardware platforms
  • Collaborating with our hardware engineers on the design of new platforms

Youre the kind of person were looking for if:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science, ECE, EE, ME or STEM related field (in progress)
  • You are comfortable writing systems-level C/C++ (or if youve written your own OS!)
  • You have familiarity developing and implementing computer networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, routing protocols, IPv6, etc.)
  • You have worked with Linux on embedded platforms
  • You have an understanding of OS fundamentals and experience working in both kernel and user space
  • You love being a part of a tight-knit, hard-working team and want to have an impact with your own work while also elevating your teammates
  • You have previous internship or large project experience

As a software engineer early in your career, you may still be identifying areas that you are curious about or in which would like to develop more depth. At Meraki, you will have the opportunity to explore multiple technology areas and problem domains. Whether you have a passion for user interfaces, distributed systems, network protocols, or embedded development or perhaps more than one of these you will be able to dive deep here. Together with your team you will craft from top to bottom the suite of innovative products that make Meraki unique.


Intern Program Overview:

Meraki interns and co-ops join the team for 12 and 16 week programs, respectively, and are placed directly onto subteams. During the program, interns/co-ops have the opportunity to work on a small starter project, such as integration and implementation of new tools, before spending the bulk of the program on a larger project, such as building the infrastructure for a new service. Projects are multi-functional, which allow insight into new languages and technologies, help encourage professional growth within engineering, and allow a sense of ownership within the team.


Merakis engineering teams place a high emphasis on mentorship. Each intern and co-op is matched 1:1 with a mentor who provides continual feedback and guidance throughout the duration of the program. Mentors help with introductions to other team members, overviews of tools and processes, and provide a seamless integration into Meraki life.


Intern Benefits:

  • Housing Assistance
  • Competitive salary
  • Weekly social events inside and outside of the office (Giants games, Exploratorium tickets, friendly soccer games)
  • Lunch and dinner daily
  • Customized laptop and desk setups
  • Medical coverage plans

Increased use of data intensive applications by industry and consumers is placing new requirements on network infrastructure. Technology advances in wireless systems allow networks providers to continually expand the capability, speed and security of their networks. Intel continues to develop next generation, multi-core communication processors while delivering current products to the top infrastructure companies in the world. position: Intern - SAP Fiori Tools, Software Engineering
description:
Requisition ID: 274783
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.

 

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

 

Contract Hours: 40 hours per week

 

Anticipated Start Date: February 2021

 

Office Location: Remote / Palo Alto, CA

 

About the team:

 

SAP UX Engineering is a global team that builds tools to allow SAP along with its customers and partners to build SAP Fiori apps more easily. Our most recent innovation is SAP Fiori tools. SAP Fiori tools is a set of extensions for SAP Business Application Studio and Visual Studio Code designed to simplify the development of SAP applications, ensuring that users can create applications both efficiently and consistently.

 

As a member of the SAP Fiori tools team in Palo Alto, you will work in a dynamic environment with colleagues around the world, helping to develop extensions for Visual Studio Code. If you have software development skills and want to contribute to developing platforms and applications that are used internally across SAP and externally worldwide, this may be the role for you.

 

Expectations & Tasks

 

  • Work as a part of our cross-functional SCRUM team to develop very high-quality software
  • Design, develop, and test usable software in close collaboration with the product owner, architect, and scrum team
  • Coordinate testing, integration, and documentation of the solution
  • Set up and maintain the auto test framework in an agile and continuous delivery environment
  • Acquire development skills in new areas and technologies in alignment with team priorities
  • Handle the design, architecture, development, code review, and testing of applications and proof of concept prototypes
  • Be comfortable working collaboratively in a virtual environment
  • Provide estimates for assigned work
  • Monitor and maintain customer support queues; Be able to confidently perform troubleshooting in the production environment, including communicating with affected users as required
  • Have fun!

 

Skills / Competencies

 

  • Experience developing web applications in HTML5, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, Web Components, React
  • Working experience with data structures, algorithms, and principles of OO design
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Ability to prioritize and work on multiple tasks
  • Working experience with test automation and continuous development models (Jenkins, Puppeteer, Sonar, JIRA and Git) is an asset
  • Excellent communications skills to coordinate with development colleagues in different regions

 

Educational Requirements

 

Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience). Recent graduates within the last 6 months will also be considered.

 

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

description:
DESCRIPTION

The Amazon Kids and Family team builds new products and services for children and their caregivers. Our flagship products, Amazon Kids and Amazon Kids+, are available across Amazon Fire Tablets, FireTV, Echo devices, Kindles and 3P mobile apps. Our world-class controls give adults a piece of mind while thousands of the most popular titles and age-appropriate content gives children endless fun. Here's more information: http://www.amazon.com/kidsplus.

You will be responsible for scoping and delivering large projects end-to-end. Responsibilities include collection of business and systems requirements from internal and external customers, writing specifications, driving project schedules from design to release, and managing the production launch. You will lead and coordinate design/implementation efforts between internal teams and partner teams within the broader Devices organization, to develop optimal solutions. You will be expected to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimize time-to-market, clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote project teams.


The right candidate will possess a strong program management background, will have demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and will have a well-rounded technical background. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in and get the job done. You will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints. An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications and deliver results in a timely fashion are essential. High judgment, ability to influence, analytical talent and leadership are key to the success in this role.

description:
Thomas Edison South (74051), United States of America, St Cloud, Minnesota


Customer Protection Innovation & Analysis Intern - Summer 2021, St. Cloud, MN


Capital One prioritizes the health and safety of our associates. In light of COVID-19, we are complying with the CDC guidelines for social distancing. The vast majority of Capital One roles, including this role, have temporarily moved to work at home. **When Capital One returns to normal operations, this role will return to the assigned onsite work location.**


To ensure productivity in a home environment, applicants must meet the space and technology requirements outlined below. These requirements will no longer be applicable once the role returns onsite.


**Work at Home Technology Requirements:**


+ A secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions of any kind

+ A reliable high-speed broadband Internet service provider (ISP):

+ Dial up or Satellite Internet service providers are not sufficient

+ ISP must be hardwired (Wifi prohibited) and must be used for Capital One purposes only during your schedule and would need to be in place at start of employment

+ The ISP speed/bandwidth must be 5 megabytes per second (minimum required) or higher (10+ preferred). Please contact your ISP for confirmation. Check your internet service provider speed/bandwidth at http://www.speedtest.net/


**Position Description:**


The Customer Protection Innovation & Analysis Intern is responsible for supporting several highly-specialized customer contact center teams focused on delivering the best possible customer experience through the process of claims intake as well as identifying and preventing fraud. Support will be provided through trend analysis and process improvement while driving digital enhancements.


**Responsibilities:**


+ Leading focus groups and brainstorming sessions

+ Process Mapping

+ Value add vs. Non-Value add reviews

+ Completion of simple and complex business analysis

+ Narrow scope project management

+ Collaboration with Customer Protection leadership in implementing process changes

+ Create and maintain performance reporting

The primary role of a Product Manager Technical Products, External Services MBA Intern (PMT-ES MBA Intern) within Amazon Web Services is to assume end-to-end product ownership over one of our technical product offerings. · Work closely with engineering teams and UX to deliver products to market

position: Intern - Global Industry and Value Advisor Analyst
description:
Requisition ID: 271186
Work Area: Administration
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.

 

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

 

Contract Hours: 40 hours per week

 

Anticipated Start Date: March 2021

 

Office Location: Virtual USA

 

Purpose & Objective of Position

 

The Industry and Value Advisory (IVA) organization is chartered with articulating the value and business case of adopting SAP Solutions and differentiating SAP as the innovation partner of choice.

 

Global IVA team is responsible for creating and disseminating value content for SAPs portfolio, building content and thought leadership, incubating and scaling organizational best practices, driving enablement across field-facing organization, and driving other key global value-focused programs.  All with a strong focus on creating value and industry content/programs for our field and customers. The intern is expected to support various initiatives of the Global and Industry Advisory team and will be working closely with the Global Industry and Value Advisory leadership team.

 

Expectations & Tasks

 

The intern is expected to support the team with various tasks. See examples of tasks, although not limited to:

  • Independently conduct research
  • Support with executive communication, e.g. research communication channels and target audience
  • Support the team in creation of various pieces of content, e.g. blogs, value papers etc.
  • Attend meetings and help with action items/follow up
  • Drive and support enablement programs e.g. help organize trainings and meetings.
  • Maintain and update the Global IVA jam site (SAP internal intranet)
  • Support coordinating the creation of value stories (e.g. help coordinate the process and write stories)
  • Help drive and update various processes for the team
  • Various ad hoc and administrative tasks

 

Skills / Competencies

 

  • Ability to analyze data and research using various sources
  • A collaborator who can work with a global team virtually
  • Great communication skills (oral and written)
  • A self-starter and independent thinker who can run with various tasks
  • A high level of integrity, accuracy and dependability
  • Curiosity to learn and a desire to bring fresh thinking/innovation to the team

 

Educational Requirements

 

  • Must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program at an accredited university
  • Preferred: Business / Economics / Technology / Communications / Strategy background
  • Open to other academic backgrounds as well

 

Qualifications

 

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications (Teams, Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
  • Previous work experience preferred

 

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.comorCareers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ:Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA:Careers@sap.com).

position: Firmware/Software Engineering Co-Op Internship (Year Long, June 2021 - June 2022) - Meraki
description:
Term: June 2021 to June 2022, Full-Time 40 hours weekly in San Francisco


The modern world runs on the Internet, and the Internet cannot exist without its underlying infrastructure! Meraki makes setting up, managing, and maintaining that infrastructure easier than it has ever been before. Meraki enables connectivity everywhere from neighborhood cafes to education institutions to global hospitality groups operating thousands of sites.


Our Hardware Team leads all products and control every aspect of creation. From architecture and initial sketches through detailed design and the final drive to mass and sustaining production, nothing escapes the Hardware team's sphere of influence and responsibility.


Meraki believes that the quality of our product is dependent on the quality of our engineers. We place a high value on nurturing the growth and development of everyone on our team. We foster an open and supportive workplace where everybody is given the opportunity to succeed!


We encourage you to learn more about Cisco Meraki and what makes us unique. 


What we look for in all intern/co-op candidates:

  • Pursuing a BA/BS in Computer Science, ECE, EE, ME or STEM related field (in progress)
  • You are able to work a full 12 month co-op term in a full time capacity within our San Francisco office (June 2021 to June 2022)
  • Clear and effective communication skills
  • Proactive learners who can quickly pick up working in multiple frameworks, languages and environments
  • Passionate team players
  • Continually able to learn from experience and eager for feedback
  • Previous internship or large scale project experience
  • Familiarity with the fundamentals of Computer Science (Javascript, CSS, Ruby on Rails, C/C++ or an understanding of databases)

Projects and Work Life:

During the program, interns/co-ops have the opportunity to work on a small starter project, such as integration and implementation of new tools, before spending the majority of the program on a larger project, such as building the infrastructure for a wireless device. Projects are cross functional, which allow insight into new languages and technologies, help encourage professional growth within engineering, and allow a sense of ownership within the team.

Merakis engineering teams place a high emphasis on mentorship. Each intern and co-op is matched 1:1 with a mentor who provides continual feedback and guidance throughout the duration of the program. Mentors help with introductions to other team members, overviews of tools and processes, and provide a seamless integration into Meraki life.


Examples of Previous Projects:

  • Hardware Program Manager for an emerging product starting at the early technical Engineering Validation Testing Phase
  • Project manager through the PVT stages up to MP
  • Exploration towards a new research-based platform using bring-up, firmware, and UI development

Intern Benefits:

  • Furnished housing in San Francisco for duration of program
  • Competitive salary
  • Weekly social events inside and outside of the office (Giants games, Exploratorium tickets, friendly soccer games)
  • Lunch and dinner daily
  • Customized laptop and desk setups
  • Medical, dental, and vision coverage plans

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.


At Cisco Meraki, we're challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We're building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone

position: Principal Technical Program Manager - Prime Video International Expansion
description:
DESCRIPTION

Prime Video is changing the way people around the world watch movies and TV shows, with thousands of titles available on an unlimited basis through Prime Video, all on hundreds of devices, including Kindle Fire, Fire TV and Stick, iPads, smart phones, smart TVs and game consoles.
Our service is available in more than 200 territories globally, and we're just getting started.

The Prime Video International team is seeking a Principal Technical Program Manager (TPM) to be the program leader for International Commerce whose mission is to offer a localized commerce (payments) experience to customers across the globe. All commerce projects under this charter are integration heavy and requires excellent leadership skills, strategic thinking, strong technical expertise, the ability to partner effectively across teams within and outside of Amazon, and the ability to manage high-impact projects. We are looking for a highly analytical, resourceful, customer focused, team oriented individual who also has the ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. He or she will have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.
